inlineContent.text: search messages

abstract.text: intent object with the specified search criteria.

inlineContent.text: Use the designated initializer instead

inlineContent.text: The recipients of the messages. You can specify multiple people to search for messages received by multiple users.
The senders of the messages. You can specify multiple people to search for messages sent by multiple users.
An array of terms to look for in the message contents. Each term constitutes a search string to be matched in the message contents.
Additional message attributes to consider during the search. For a list of possible values, see
The dates associated with the messages. Use this parameter to specify the range of dates to search.
The identifier strings of the messages. Use this parameter when you want to specify messages based on their unique ID.
An array of identifiers from
objects. Use this parameter to search the notifications associated with your app.
An array of strings representing any group addresses receiving the message.

Normally, you do not create instances of this class yourself. Instead, Siri creates instances when the user asks to search their messages. However, you can use this method during testing to create intent objects in order to validate your intent handling code paths. Specify
for any parameters that you do not want used during the search.

abstract.text: The data for a local or remote notification the system delivers to your app.
Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.
Constants that indicate a message search filter.
Information about a person participating in a SiriKit interaction.
A request to list the messages that match the specified criteria.
The names of any groups associated with the message.
The operator that defines how to use the group names in the search criteria.
